the perishable factors in creation are the organs of cognition, feeling, and perception. The infinite Self expresses its power through perishable prakṛti, which manifests as the body, senses, mind, intellect, ego, and the various objects of the senses. Collectively these are known as adhibhūta. This is also called apara prakṛti, the lower nature of God.

Daivata means presiding deities of the sense organs, mind, and intellect. Adhidaivata is the indweller that presides over mind, intellect, and senses in a living being. Adhidaivata represents the vital energy or life of the whole creation, including both the sentient and the insentient. Adhiydaivata is known by the names Sūtrātma, Hiraṇyagarbha, Prajāpati, and Brahmā.
